attributes.action: consider this green miles scheme and deem it worthy of public endorsement by the Department for Transport.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Green miles scheme. This is an informal locally-based car sharing idea routed in the good will and generosity of communities towards neighbours near and far, particularily OAPs and students. By cutting the top 3 inches from a green plastic garden rubbish bag (easiest while still folded)a sash is made.
One such sash worn across chest and shoulder or draped diagonally over the back of a car seat would signal a readiness to give lifts or two such sashes, crossed over, would indicate a readiness to give as well as swop lifts.
Car insurers have long recognised the benefits of car sharing schemes and their policies usually make this plain, provided a profit is not made (so a charge is possible). We trust nobody would take advantage of others. After checking their insurance policy we hope lots of drivers with 1-3 empty seats will consider taking part*.
It's idealistic enough to work and we would welcome the Minister for Transport on board! See *The Stern Review(2007) p247 etc..
